Description: Nice Lefty OLP Guitar Licensed by Ernie Ball (MM-1) Probably from 2007 or so... These guitars are pretty good for the price, if you like Music Mans and do not want to pay big $$$. This guitar is good enough for gigs or just practice. The pickups are suprisingly hot. The sustain is good. I do not think that they are made anymore... This one is in good shape and plays/sounds pretty good. It currently has .09s on it. No major cosmetic issues or playing issues, but depending on you playing preferences, you might want to have a pro setup done for optimal playability. I personally think it is good where it is, but I figured I should say that. The trem block where the top spring was connected broke, so I have the spring connected to the next one which seems to make no difference...the ground wire on the trem also separated from the solder joint, so I just connected it to a spring which works just fine. Also, no trem arm. The Roadrunner gig bag is practically new. I willbe sure to safely pack the guitar for gig bag shipping. Feel free to contact me if you have any questions. $39.99 S&H
Title: Left Handed OLP MM-1 Music Man Electric Guitar w Roadrunner Gigbag Lefty VH LH
ConditionDescription: Nice shape- plays and sounds good.  See pics for condition. The one noticable thing is the trem block where the spring tension broke the spring hole - It is still set fine with hole below it.   The ground wire on the trem also separated from the solder joint, so Ijust connected it to a spring which worksjust fine. No trem arm.
